Subjective: Headache for 2 months; worse on right side; associated with glare, nausea; no vomiting, no flashes of light. Family history of migraines (father) and cluster headaches (grandfather). No fever, no weight loss. No smoking, no drugs, minimal alcohol. Patient is a medical student, exercises regularly (4x/week). Impact: Unable to join social activities, prefers dark room. Request: Wants to know diagnosis and best course of action.
Objective: BP 120/80; pulse 50. Cranial nerves intact; strength normal; Romberg's normal; gait slightly off. No other abnormalities.
Assessment: Migraine; likely given family history and symptoms. No signs of cluster headache or other serious conditions.
Plan: Start paracetamol as soon as symptoms begin; max 4000mg/day
Keep headache diary to track triggers and patterns
Follow-up in 4 weeks; sooner if worse
Patient education on migraine management via thuisarts.nl
